meanings.definition: Feeling or showing fear or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The little girl felt trepidacious before her first day of school.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest made him feel trepidacious as he walked through it.
meanings.sent3: The trepidacious puppy barked at its own shadow, thinking it was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The trepidacious whispers of the wind made the night seem eerie and unsettling.
meanings.sent5: Her trepidacious heart raced as she approached the haunted house.

meanings.sent1: The trepidacious movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent2: The trepidacious roller coaster ride made her scream with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The trepidacious thunderstorm caused the cat to hide under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The trepidacious news of the impending storm sent everyone rushing to prepare.
meanings.sent5: The trepidacious atmosphere in the room made it hard to breathe.
